headline: Is NIKE Struggling to Balance Direct-to-Consumer Strategy and Scale?
summary: NKE's DTC push boosts margins and data, but rising inventories and softer demand expose limits as the brand works to rebalance digital and wholesale.

headline: NIKE Stock Breaks Below 50-Day SMA: Buying Sign or Time to Exit?
summary: NKE slips below its 50 and 200-day SMAs as margin pressure, China weakness and valuation concerns keep momentum bearish despite a global brand.

headline: A Look At Nike (NKE) Valuation As Converse Layoffs And Leadership Shake Up Unfold
summary: Nike (NKE) is overhauling its Converse unit after prolonged sales pressure, cutting jobs and reshaping leadership as part of a broader turnaround plan that has sparked fresh questions about the brand’s long term role. See our latest analysis for NIKE. NIKE’s recent Converse layoffs and the wider “Win Now” reset come after a 1-year total shareholder return decline of about 10%, alongside a 3-year total shareholder return fall of roughly 47% and a 5-year total shareholder return drop of around...

headline: Nike Resets Converse As Investors Question Growth And Valuation
summary: NIKE (NYSE:NKE) is reshaping its Converse business with leadership changes and layoffs as part of a broader brand reset. Senior executives are departing Converse while the unit revisits its marketplace strategy under new leadership. Industry speculation has emerged around a possible sale of Converse as NIKE reviews its brand portfolio. For NIKE at a share price of $62.41, these moves come against a challenging share performance backdrop, with the stock showing a 10.0% decline over the past...
